so... yeah
dbd imo the most dogshit game i have ever played (in this days) i plaing dbd from 2016 and have over 6k hrs (600h on this acc and 5900h on banned acc) because it's addictive but in a wrong way. Let me tell you why the game is terribly annoying but also satisfying and because of that most player still want to play this game. Back in the day this game was fun to play, have some bugs but fun bugs, now dbd has a lot of bugs that can make your game unfun to play.
So let me tell you what this game  suck on
-Balans and new rank system-cuz one update every pression that you make as killer is gone because survs can make his own heal spot on the othersite of the map and its hard to control this is not facilitated by the ranking system cuz you can play literaly against player who is new at this game and also ageinst someone who playing like a god.
-even if you have a good computer you will be have clipping
-bugs i don't want to talk about that just type in yt "dbd bugs" xD
-community yeah... they are not very nice. If you win they will call you "camper,tunneler or even cheater" but if you lose they will write "ez,noob,lern to play" one time when i win a game i got comment "i hope you will step in lego" imo that was funny but anyway you win you got bullying you lose also got bullying.
-and you need to spend a lot of time to have anything
-devs are lying
it's not worth to buy in this days. Hope i helped you. have a nice day

Entertaining game that I always find myself coming back to. Know two things before you play: 1) the devs would rather release new content than fix old bugs, and 2) the community is incredibly toxic; expect solo queue to be a nightmare with idiot teammates that are either bad or sabotage you, and killers that will camp or tunnel you out of the game. End game chat is either great with ggs or awful with "kill yourself and uninstall". Good luck.

This game is shitty i suck ass in this game and while i was playing with my buddies for fun, I got a notice that i got banned. Don't play this game, you get ban out of nowhere and will waste your time and money in this game!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!..

This game used to be good/fun, but with all the recent updates, devs' focus has been purely on buffing killers, e.g. jumping from one side of the map to the other, allowing to spam perk to see survivors around all time...yet nerfing helpful perks for survivors. And obviously bad killers would take advantage of those, making it easier to tunnel. In summary, can't recommend anymore as the fun is gone and the updates don't make sense. Just my opinion.

O sistema de matchmaking n√£o √© muito bom, mas o jogo tem um modelo de partidas r√°pidas que s√£o viciantes, aliado ao sistema de perks, mapas e killers com habilidades diferentes faz com que cada partida seja √∫nica. Outro ponto positivo √© a lore do jogo que, para quem se interessa, √© um prato cheio, muito bem trabalhada e cheia de easter eggs. De ponto negativo ficam os diversos bugs que s√£o corriqueiros mas quase nunca afetam de fato a experi√™ncia a ponto de se tornar "injog√°vel". Dead by daylight tem gr√°ficos razo√°veis e uma boa gama de personagens cheios de diversidade. Vale a pena jogar com amigos.

Inoltre ci sono alcuni giocatori veramente scarsi che ti facecamperano perch√® non sanno giocare. Consigliato a chi gioca in team e a chi piace il genere horror

This game is quite good, but NO LONGER fun since you will meet a ton of CHEATERS! And guess what the most surprising? The developer and publisher DO NOT REALLY CARE--even you report the cheater--and you are getting banner if you leave the hacked macth!!!

Finally uninstalled this game a bit over a month ago after 400+ hours, haven't regretted it at all. 

The game is great and its lots of fun playing as or against the majority of the killers (especially the licensed ones), but BHVR has made it clear they simply think they know more than it's player base and refuse to address any of the game's largest problems. 

Horrible progression, terrible ranked support, game breaking bugs and hackers that still remain in the game years later. The core game is a lot of fun but unless you're picking it up with friends or are playing on a free week, hard pass from me.

Game is great as a whole. The build combos are really fun once you get the perks online, but I don't mind the grind all that much, it's why I keep playing. HOWEVER, there are a set of 5-6 survivor perks, that are mix and matched in every game, on every survivor, so much so, that becomes unfun to play against, even during good games as killer. And even after playing the build on survivor, I can confidently say, it's even less fun. Sweat central is what this game has become and will continue to be  until something is changed with those perks.

All that aside, in the exceptionally rare case where you aren't playing against a bullying group running meta builds, the game is genuinely fun and entertaining, regardless of whether you're playing killer or survivor. I give the game itself like a 7.8 out of 10, but the average game experience like a 4 out of 10.
great progression and game play. love it even though i hate it if you know what i mean.
It takes skill but still very good

I still manage to enjoy this game most of the time despite its faults.  I've been playing over 1,000 hours over the course of a few years and have learned to deal with the most frustrating elements of the game.  The one positive thing I have to say about this game is that it's by far the best in its genre - no other asymmetrical horror game comes close.   However, while as a veteran player I have learned to live with the game's frustrations, I think those frustrations are too overwhelming to recommend the game for new players.

The first and biggest reason is the absolutely ridiculous grind.  When I started a few years ago, the number of characters and perks in the game was far lower than it is today, and the grind at the time was still daunting.  Most of the friends I started playing with quit within a month because the grind was too overwhelming.  And a few years later, it's far, far more overwhelming.  Unless you're willing to put thousands of hours into this game (even if I wanted to, I couldn't as I have a full-time job and a family), you'll struggle to keep up with acquiring the new charcaters, perks and cosmetics that are continuously added to the game.

The second biggest frustration is the lack of balance at the highest and lowest levels.  At the lowest levels, new survivor players get steamrolled by killers because they have no idea what to do.  This is overcomable though if players are willing to put in the time and practice to get better.  However, the imbalance at the highest levels are not overcomable because of the game design.  Experienced survivor players that can coordinate on comms (this was never intended when the game was first designed) will usually win against even the best killer players, and there's no amount of practice or improvement that killers can put into the game that will overcome that.  Experienced survivors benefit from coordination and the pure math that goes into how long it takes for killers to down and hook survivors compared to how long it takes to complete generators.  Killer players have been complaining about this imbalance for years, and BHVR has done very little to address it because they worry it will result in experienced survivor players (which make up a bulk of their revenue base) to leave the game.  So what is happening right now is the number of killer players keeps declining because veteran killers are increasingly frustrated with the imbalance, while new killer players eventually get to higher levels and then experience the same level of frustration.  This has led for longer and longer queue times for survivor players during peak hours because there is a significant lack of players willing to play the killer side.

There are lots of other things to complain about, but I won't go into too much detail, will just note some of them here:
- Every update results in a ton of bugs because the game code has become so spaghetti over time and has been poorly optimized
- Increasingly poor performance on the same hardware because of poor optimization
- It takes forever for the devs to implement even the most basic bug fixes
- Devs focusing resources on changes to the game that seemingly nobody is asking for, while ignoring changes that are commonly mentioned in the game forums
- Focusing resources on game content such as new cosmetics and characters rather than game health improvements
- I myself have not experienced a lot of hackers, but many on the forums have complained about increasing frequency of hackers
- Devs retaliating against well-known content creators who voice legitimate criticisms about the devs or the game

BUT, still very fun, especially if you have friends to play with.

The game is very fun once you start getting used to it. It requires some practice and map learning but once you start developing this game knowledge you could pretty easily get hooked, pun intended.
Honestly, at first I was scared from joining online, but honestly once I did I really enjoyed playing both survivor and killer (I like killer a lot). Once I start to learn all the maps, and get a grasp on all the mechanics I'm sure I'm going to love this game, and you could to!
A fun game with funny moments. The skill ceiling and floor are both limitless. Be the monster or run. Either way, its a blast
Dead By Daylight is very fun game to play with friends while comunnicating, beware of the super sweaty killers and bad survivers while playing without your friends.
